column4: I'm trying to install drivers for a WMP54GS Broadcom BCM4318 14e4:4318 PCI wireless card. I have tried the ones with the windows install CD and some more that were listed on sourceforge. I have gotten through the Ndiswrapper instructions on help.ubuntu and when I try use 'sudo modprobe ndiswrapper' I get 'WARNING: All congif files need .conf:/etc/modprobe.d/ blacklist, it will be ignored in...
...a future release.' I get the same error again below that but 'ndiswrapper' instead of 'blacklist.' This is on Ubuntu 10.10
It seems that no one got that wireless card here at the moment you can try to google your wireless card name and add Ubuntu driver in the end or post in the forum about it
yeah, ive been doing that for the past week
